decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

Heritage Statement; Design and Access Statement; Existing Site Layout; Existing Locality and Block Plans; Proposed Locality and Block Plans; Proposed Site Layout Rev A; Existing & Proposed Rear Elevations; Proposed Elevations Rev A

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or development shall take place until a stage 1 written scheme of investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing.  For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, and the programme and methodology of site evaluation and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.

If heritage assets of archaeological interest are identified by stage 1 then for those parts of the site which have archaeological interest a stage 2 WSI shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing.  For land that is included within the stage 2 WSI, no demolition/development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed stage 2 WSI which shall include:

A. The statement of significance and research objectives, the programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.

B. Where appropriate, details of a programme for delivering related positive public benefits.

The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the stage 2 WSI.

Reason: To safeguard the archaeological interest of this site

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the details hereby approved, no development shall take place until details of the following items noted below have been submitted to, and agreed in writing by, the local planning authority:

A) Details of the foundations and structural separation of the new 2.4m high wall hereby approved (in the form of typical section drawings, elevations and plans). The new wall shall be structurally separated from the existing historic wall which demarcates the western edge of the outdoor seating area and section.

B) Details and samples of the materials (or appropriate specification) to be used in the construction new 2.4m high wall including type of brick, mortar and other such brickwork features.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details so agreed and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the development is carried out to the highest standards of architecture and materials.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, the brickwork bond (ie. the arrangement of bricks) of the new 2.4m wall shall match that of the existing historic wall which demarcates the western side of the beer garden/seating area. 

Reason: To ensure the historic character and appearance of listed building and associated features are maintained.

Condition : 6 - No music, whether amplified, live or other, nor any other amplified and/or other similar noise source, shall be played in any external area of the beer garden/seating area at the rear of the property. 

REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents
description: Installation of 2.4m high wall and gate to side and rear elevations; installation of pergola at rear; landscaping
